security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation for git branch completion workflow. No executable code, no network calls, no file access beyond local git repository operations guided by user intent.

content.user_title: Finish Git development branches with merge or PR
content.value_statement: Managing feature branches at completion requires running tests, choosing integration method, and cleaning up. This skill automates the branch completion workflow with safe defaults and user confirmation for destructive actions.
actual_capabilities: Verifies tests pass before proceeding with branch completion
Detects base branch from main, master, or develop
Presents 4 options: merge locally, create PR, preserve branch, or discard
Creates GitHub pull requests using gh CLI with extracted commit titles
Cleans up git worktrees after merge or discard operations
Blocks progress on test failures or merge conflicts with clear error states
limitations: Does not resolve merge conflicts automatically
Requires gh CLI installed for automated PR creation
Does not push code to remote before PR creation
Cannot create PRs on non-GitHub repositories

use_cases.title: Complete feature work
use_cases.description: Finish feature branches and merge to main after tests pass

use_cases.title: Create pull requests
use_cases.description: Push branch and create GitHub PR with commit-derived title

use_cases.title: Clean up worktrees
use_cases.description: Remove temporary worktrees after integration completes

prompt_templates.title: Complete current branch
prompt_templates.prompt: Finish this development branch. Tests are passing.

prompt_templates.title: Create pull request
prompt_templates.prompt: Push this branch and create a pull request for review.

prompt_templates.title: Merge locally
prompt_templates.prompt: Merge this feature branch into main locally.

prompt_templates.title: Discard work
prompt_templates.prompt: Discard this branch and clean up the worktree.

output_examples.input: Finish this development branch. Tests are passing.
output: âœ“ MERGED - Branch merged to main, worktree cleaned

best_practices: Run tests manually before invoking this skill to avoid repeated verification
Confirm the target branch when multiple candidates exist
Use Option 2 (PR creation) for code review workflows
anti_patterns: Invoking without verifying tests pass first
Proceeding with merge conflicts without resolution

faq.question: Which Claude tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works in any git repository.

faq.question: What happens if tests fail?
faq.answer: Skill reports BLOCKED:TESTS with failure count and stops. You must fix tests first.

faq.question: Can I use this without gh CLI?
faq.answer: Yes, but PR creation will fail. Install gh CLI or push manually and create PR via web.

faq.question: Is my work safe from accidental deletion?
faq.answer: Yes. Option 4 requires typing 'discard' for confirmation. Options 2 and 3 preserve worktrees.

faq.question: What base branch does it detect?
faq.answer: Checks main, master, and develop. Selects branch with most recent merge-base to current branch.

faq.question: How is this different from manual git commands?
faq.answer: Automates workflow, provides safe defaults, handles worktree cleanup, and enforces confirmations.
